text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with romano bean salad this is one
of my favorite favorite summer salads
reminds me of my grandfather he used to
make this he'd actually picked the beans
fresh boil them and do this very very
simple garlic and mint dressing it was
fantastic
so I want to show you how to make it
could not be easier we're gonna start
with a bunch of Romano beans I don't
know how much I have this works with any
amount I probably have like a pound
there alright to prep our beans I'm
simply gonna snap off the stem and where
it attaches to the plant that little
pointy in there you can leave that you
don't have to pull that off so the
little pointy end stays the other end
where attaches to the plant snap that
off I'm gonna salt some water bring it
to a rolling boil and then blanch our
beans so we want them tender we do not
want tough crunchy beans forget about a
bright green salad that's not what this
is about this is about deliciousness we
don't care what this looks like by the
way it's still gonna look cool but it's
just not gonna be bright green so right
here you're thinking oh they're bright
green I should stop don't stop so you're
gonna be the judge
taste one it should be just tender not
soft but not crunchy either at this
point I determine mine
we're perfect so once you've determined
they are perfectly just barely tender
remove them into a bowl I'm gonna drain
the water carefully but I'm not gonna
rinse those I'm gonna let them sit there
just like that don't worry it's okay in
a mortar and pestle I'm gonna take some
fresh sliced garlic some freshly torn
mint a big pinch of coarse salt and I'm
gonna smash that okay
so we're actually gonna use mint twice
here one beforehand in the sort of
marinating dressing part and then a
little bit of fresh mint when we serve
I'm going to put a couple tablespoons of
olive oil in and that is looking pretty
amazing when that's done I'm going to
pour that olive oil garlic mint mixture
over the warm beans last but not least a
good sprinkling of white wine vinegar
you can also use red wine vinegar sherry
vinegar any kind of vinegar you want to
finish season with salt and pepper
give them a really good toss now
remember the beans were still warm so
that really is gonna help them absorb
all these flavors but you're not done
throw those in a ziploc bag pour over
the dressing squeeze out as much of the
air as you can without you know swish in
the beans and let that sit in the
refrigerator a minimum of four hours
overnight is better so I'm gonna leave
mine overnight you're gonna see that
acids definitely gonna change the color
of the bean totally worth it that's what
it's supposed to look like
to finish do a chiffonade of freshly
sliced mint leaves so when it comes to
this salad you can have one that's
bright green and beautiful or you can
have one that tastes amazing you can't
have both
having said that who's to say that's not
a beautiful color I think that's
beautiful so take my advice cook the
beans all the way through let them sit
overnight in the dressing you'll lose
the color but you'll gain so much more
anyway hope you give it a try I hope you
find some nice beautiful Romano beans at
the local market all the ingredients are
on food wishes calm as usual and as
always enjoy
you
